page.title: 10WICK FARM.
page.content: The present farmhouse has 12th. century remains in it's structure.There used to be a small hamlet of Wick, the last cottage was pulled down 15 years ago.The farmhouse and buildings are of Cotswold stone.The main barn is known locally as the Leper church.In Medieval times the monks of Malmesbury Abbey sent lepers to Wick. The present family have owned the farm since the 17th.century.100 acres are owned by the Duke of Beaufort.Wick Farm is 500 acres and is arable/beef.Wheat and barley are the main crops .Cattle are sold at local markets.5 people work the farm,all one family.The area suffers from 'black leg 'disease,which can kill cattle overnight.Each year in April 400 cattle are bought.Recently many new trees have been planted.
